website_summaries.verdict: Comfort rated for 19°F, this bag can be used mummy style or envelope style.
pros: Can be used as mummy- or envelope-style bag
600 fill power DriDown insulation (natural down treated with a water-resistant finish for better loft and drying)

customer_reviews.title: Bottom zipper slider came off during first use.
customer_reviews.text: The bottom slider came off and was lost during the first use, it appears there is not a bottom stop to prevent the slider from running off the end. Also, one side of the zipper pins is plastic while the other side is metal. The plastic pin is bent and breaking, both sides of the zipper pin should have been metal. Luckily I was able to take the remaining slider and make it work. The only reason I did not give this a 1 is that the sleeping bag itself is good, packs well and so far (after 2 uses) lives up to its specs.
customer_reviews.author: BCV1218

customer_reviews.title: I love that it folds up really small
customer_reviews.text: It took a long time to find this sleeping bag! I shopped around for days online before I finally found this one. I love that it folds up really small, which is a necessity for back packing in the mountains. It's very warm and comfortable, with a nice soft lining, but it is also sturdy. It's a nice weight for the warmth level (less than 3 pounds.) Very happy with this find!
customer_reviews.author: Loves Her Fam

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad I did this because I found the overall length ...
customer_reviews.text: I recently used this bag on a backpacking trip in July near Seven Springs PA. The temperature got into the mid 50's at night. I found my legs sweating at times.Mummy bags are inherently narrow, and this one is no different. As an active sleeper I found it restricting. The trade off is the saved weight, and space it takes up in your pack. I am 5''11'' 190 lbs. I ordered the long because it happened to be the cheapest price out of the three sizes carried by Amazon, and not a third party. I'm glad I did this because I found the overall length just about perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Awesome deal on a great bag
customer_reviews.text: I used this bag for an end of summer 5 day/night hike in Denali Nat'l Park, Alaska. This bag was everything one would want from a sleeping bag: light, compact, warm, and comfortable. The only issue I had, was that I sometimes had a bit of difficulty with the zipper catching on the fold material (but didn't harm anything), and the toggle on the draw string around the face wasn't always easy to loosen. Minor inconveniences. I was comfortable in nighttime temps down to almost freezing (and using a decent full length air mattress), with just underwear on. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Kubasta

customer_reviews.title: It says Unisex, It's not
customer_reviews.text: The description said unisex, so I bough it for my Girlfriend, the tags say Men's comfort temperatures. So I suppose for women they may be colder, She said It's pretty cold inside the tent with temps outside around 20 F. Also there are several big lines where there is no loft, feathers. I don't recommend it. I got it for 60 dollars so I guess I got what I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: I would give it a 5 but at 40 degrees wearing full base layers and socks It still got pretty chilly. I know that rated for 20 means ...
customer_reviews.text: Very light and packable bag. I have only used it once so far but everything worked well. I would give it a 5 but at 40 degrees wearing full base layers and socks It still got pretty chilly. I know that rated for 20 means you wont freeze to death at 20 but it seems like you'd be a bit warmer. But I think it still performed well given the weight of the bag. Actually seems quite roomy to sleep in.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Its light, and convinient.
customer_reviews.text: Used it when hiking in grand canyon in Winter. I am not a winter hiker, and it was my first winter hike experience. The bag is light and fits easily in my backpack. I am glad I took it with me, else would have frozen in the 22F temperature, in the night. BUT, I was wearing three layers, with a ski cap, and still was cold in my tent. The outside temp was 20-22F in the night. I did survive the night, but it was not comfortable by any means. I was later told , to add 10-15 degrees to the sleeping bag rating, to be comfortable in it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Warm, lightweight, not too expensive
customer_reviews.text: After borrowing my friend's Kelty Cosmic for a backpacking trip I was convinced to get one myself. He had the previous version of the 20 that was a nice red color. Wish the new version were still in that color. Otherwise performs just as well. Packs easily into its stuff sack and kept me warm on a recent camping trip to the Smoky Mountains in December with ~20-30F nights.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Just got back from three night in Southern Utah that we’re probably in the thirty’s each night. The first night is slept in my underwear and was warm, and the other two nights I slept in running pants and a running shirt and was super warm. Love this bag so far! UPDATE: just took this bag on a winter camp with my scouts and i love it. I slept in my thermals and was comfortable. I am a warm sleeper, so when i buy one for my wife who is a cold sleeper i will get her the zero degree, but i will definitely go for a cosmic.
customer_reviews.author: DANIEL R THURSTON

customer_reviews.title: This defect should have been noticed easily on inspection
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived with a misaligned double zipper, which unfortunately is hard to fix without removing the endcaps or applying excessive force to the zipper and potentially ripping the bag. This defect should have been noticed easily on inspection, so I'm concerned about quality control. The bag seemed otherwise as expected, and I'm hoping the replacement I've requested through Amazon will cause me to replace this review with a higher rating.
customer_reviews.author: SQ

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the best bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best bang for your buck. Im 5'10 and could have used a regular but i got the long for $124 it was the best deal. With the long i can fit some clothes in the bag with for cold mornings and if one part of me is cold i can shift the extra loft to that spot. There isnt a better down bag at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan S. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Kelty makes a good bag.
customer_reviews.text: Solid sleeping bag. Used it 15 states this summer and performed well as a light-moderate bag. I wouldnt use it in the winter in Anchorage, but still good quality. Snug inside. Just be careful with the zippers like all bags. Dont snag material when you blindly slash up or down with the zipper.
customer_reviews.author: C. M. Rieman

customer_reviews.title: A very pretty and comfortable bag
customer_reviews.text: A very pretty and comfortable bag. I sleep hot and this has been too warm on more than once occasion, which is much nicer than being too cold. My one gripe is that the stitching on the baffles seems kind of weak. one of the lines is already unthreading itself. So far this has had no effect and I like the bag so much for the price I'm still giving it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: will m.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bag! Packs super small and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bag! Packs super small and lightweight! Very warm and fluffs up quickly once unpacked! A bit snug on a broad shouldered man. For the cost and weight it is a very good bag for backpacking that won't break the bank! The long is the right size for 6' plus. The short is perfect for a 5'1" person who is tired of everything being so oversized! Yes we got 2! Can't wait to hit the trail again....
customer_reviews.author: WWI Flying Ace

customer_reviews.title: 100% satisfied. A winter camper.
customer_reviews.text: This down bag is warm like it is rated. Unless you sleep in your pj's without a sleeping pad when your winter camping. The zipper works very well. All zippers snag but I find that with this bag to be a infrequent occurrence.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Versatile bag, came recommended, I can see why. Worth the $$$
customer_reviews.text: Expensive but worth it. Wouldn’t put it in the washer or dryer, just spot clean with a damp rag, but great for needing a compact bag that keeps you warm. Wearing a base layer makes you warm even below 20 degrees and keeping the bag unzipped helps cool you down in warmer temps. My son has the regular size and I have the long since I’m 6’-4”. Fits well even around the shoulders unlike other bags that seem to be long enough but construct movement of the arms.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Rolls into a good compact size. Keeps you warm.
customer_reviews.text: Convenient for fall, winter and early spring back pack camping. Keeps you warm while reasonably dress overnight for the conditions. Quickly dries out it when spread out under direct sunlight. Has not taken on a stale or dank smell when properly dried out after every camp out.
customer_reviews.author: L’escargot

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, excellent for the price but a little ...
customer_reviews.text: Great bag, excellent for the price but a little snug on me (5'10"). I ended up giving the regular to my wife and buying the long version, now we are both warm and cozy on trips.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great.  Perfect for 6'5" side-sleeper.
customer_reviews.text: Great! Light, comfortable, and warm. I'm 6'5", and there is plenty of room for me. The footbox is generous too, which is a concern because I'm a side-sleeper. Because this bag is so light, it hugs you comfortably, when side-sleeping. Great price, relative to other down bags.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron P. Mulhollen

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Used this in multiple cold weather overnight trips. Kept me perfectly warm and cozy in 20 degree weather, with nothing else but my clothes and this sleeping bag to protect me from the conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Kelty cosmic 20 sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Used this Kelty sleeping bag for backpacking and it served its purpose, warm and comfortable, did well in temperatures in the 30s, I live in Southern California and temperatures don’t get super low. This sleeping bag worked great for me.
customer_reviews.author: martin

customer_reviews.title: Would highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Was a gift and the recipient was very happy. Warm and toasty, easy to pack and carry. Very good value for the price
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Grote

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag, A Little Snug
customer_reviews.text: Quality seems good and is overall a nice bag. I am 5'10/200 lbs and found the bag to be a little snug for me. Luckily, I bought it for my 12 year old to use on a hiking trip so it wasn't a problem. The zipper was easy to use and I had minimal issues with material snagging. Fit back in the sack easily and I am happy with the purchase for $88.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Hughey

customer_reviews.title: It's comfy and lightweight and packs down well but good heavens does it smell weird
customer_reviews.text: It's comfy and lightweight and packs down well but good heavens does it smell weird. I had to leave it out in my bedroom for two weeks just to desensitize myself to the odor.
customer_reviews.author: Clement Bilhorn

customer_reviews.title: Not the bag for me...
customer_reviews.text: My feet got cold in 35F degree weather. For a bag of this weight I was disappointed, but I am a cold sleeper.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Anthony LeBlanc

customer_reviews.title: Good value.
customer_reviews.text: I own 4 of these for family backpacking at 9K - 13K feet elevation. In August, we woke up to a hard frost over everything, but we stayed warm all night (I always wear a beanie). Great value when on sale.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sorensen

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, warm and comfortable. The drawstring around the head does not close very well.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Felt like Goldie locks - not too hot not too cold, just right!
customer_reviews.author: Just can't buy enough

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a down bag
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag. Super soft interior and packs fairly small for a 20 degree bag. I’d call it comfy for me (a male) down to 35 or so, at 20 degrees I’d want full clothes and my down jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Sleeping Bag is a Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: Nice and warm and since I am 5'2" the size fits me just right. Packs up small enough to easily throw in the trunk when I travel. Otherwise it fits nicely in my emergency supply box. There are no negatives that I've found.
customer_reviews.author: JoTodd

customer_reviews.title: I have taken this out on some pretty cold nights doing desert camping
customer_reviews.text: I have taken this out on some pretty cold nights doing desert camping. I haven't really pushed the temperature limit to 20 degrees, but around the mid 30s low 40s this has held up and kept me comfy and warm. A really great sleeping bag for the price range!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah Molinaro

customer_reviews.title: Warm, light, packs down mall and a great value-- can't ask for more.
customer_reviews.text: The temperature rating is appropriate and this light, packable bag kept me toasty during fall camping. Don't hesitate.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Bloom

customer_reviews.title: Warm and easy
customer_reviews.text: Very light, easy to pack in the sack, and warm on a mild night. I only tried it when it was nice out, and I needed to sleep with the zipper open to keep from getting too hot.
customer_reviews.author: emf6

customer_reviews.title: Great for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a nice bag. I paired it with Keltys medium compression sack and it packs down so small!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Huddleston

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Kept me cosy on a 37 degree night. Takes little space when in its stuff bag. Quality workmanship.
customer_reviews.author: Ken L

customer_reviews.title: Nice and compact
customer_reviews.text: Nice and compact, but I was cold in 40 degrees, so I'm not sure how this is rated for 20..
customer_reviews.author: Elina Pro

customer_reviews.title: Price and performance, this is a great bag
customer_reviews.text: Love the bag for the weight and price point. I originally ordered myself the normal length, but ordered a long length and gave the normal to my wife.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far It works as advertised. Just not much ...
customer_reviews.text: So far It works as advertised. Just not much room in it for me AND the dog. Dog thinks I should get my own.
customer_reviews.author: Greg W

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight but very warm!!
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight but very warm - it really is the ideal hiking bag. Love the quality and performance this bag brings.
customer_reviews.author: Tania M

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very warm, I did notice some of the feathers coming out every now and then.
customer_reviews.author: Tanner P.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good sleeping bag, kept me warm down to 32f. Easy to roll back up into the bag
customer_reviews.author: Savvy Shopper 17

customer_reviews.title: Not too cold, not (usually) too hot
customer_reviews.text: Near-perfect compromise temperature. A bit too warm for warm nights.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Brown

customer_reviews.title: happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Although it is slightly heavy, the bag is warm enough, happy with purchase. Brought second for spouse.
customer_reviews.author: Jai

customer_reviews.title: I loved this sleeping bag - light
customer_reviews.text: I loved this sleeping bag - light, small, and very comfortable. I was plenty warm during my 10-day camping trip to Iceland.
customer_reviews.author: Donna LaV.

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and very comfy
customer_reviews.text: Used this sleeping bag in my hammock while backpacking in northern Michigan!
customer_reviews.author: Elias Olague

customer_reviews.title: Compact, warm, lovely
customer_reviews.text: SO warm and comfy. The zipper slides easily and I haven't found any issues with it catching. Short size fits me perfectly (I'm 5'4"). Airs out well. No complaints at all.
customer_reviews.author: Grey Hackett

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag is fantastic. Keeps me very warm in cold temperatures, and is large enough so I can move around a bit. I reccomend this one to all my backpacking friends.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this bag
customer_reviews.text: I used it as my bed when I was in AK last year, and it was toasty warm and comfy. Good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: A great lightweight sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my daughter ... an avid camper and couch surfer. She absolutely loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Laura D

customer_reviews.title: Easy to roll up too
customer_reviews.text: Cozy sleeping bag! Slept in 25F with wind and felt warm all night! Easy to roll up too!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Neff

customer_reviews.title: Awesome first experience
customer_reviews.text: I have tried this bag once and definitely a great value for money. It's light and warm.
customer_reviews.author: Revti Raman Singh

customer_reviews.title: super warm and good quality
customer_reviews.text: super warm and good quality! I wish there was a pocket, but that's the only thing! I love this bag! :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable but a little on the small side 5'3" and I took up the whole thing
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bag!
customer_reviews.text: Took it backpacking for my daughter. Compacts small and is ideal weight.
customer_reviews.author: sharpie13

customer_reviews.title: Should be rated at 50 degrees...
customer_reviews.text: Although this bag certainly looks nice and is very lightweight for backpacking, it completely fails at the most crucial function: keeping you warm. I was uncomfortable at 40 degrees. By 30 degrees I was shivering. Forget 20 degrees; had I gambled on it any lower than the 30 I did use it for, I would have gotten hypothermia. I almost never leave reviews, but this was not only disappointing but alarming. The manufacturers of this bag are putting lives at risk by advertising it for a temperature it cannot withstand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bag that packs down really small
customer_reviews.text: Very nice bag. Very comfortable and the part I liked best is it packs down extremely small. I'm 6' so I found this to be slightly on the small side so I'm going to exchange this to a long bag. Reg is just a drop to small, you will probably want that extra room. All in all this is a great bag.
customer_reviews.author: Dano777

customer_reviews.title: A good bag
customer_reviews.text: It does what promises. It is a wam, light bag. It will keep you warm on all but the coldest nights. I would like a bit more room at the foot.
customer_reviews.author: Howard B. Keck

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Texas
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for Texas. Used it in my ENO hammock and a Klymit insulated V pad in mid 30 degree weather. It was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: LOVE my Kelty Cosmic 20 ... kept me very warm on a glacier in Peru. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bag for the price
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bag for the price! I own 2 of the cosmic 20 and a cosmic 0, they keep me warm in all seasons here in Idaho.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size and Super Warm!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a backpacking trip! Fit perfectly inside my pack and kept me warm each night.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Bak

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a lighter sleeping bag for backpacking and chose this one. I was concerned as well with size I am 5ft 10inches and 250 pounds. I went with the long to get a bit more space around my arms and was glad i did it makes all the difference. As I am in Florida I don't get down to the lower temps but so far I have used it to cover myself on cooler morning. I expect to get some more colder weather experience later this year as I get into our local camping weather. It can be a bit tricky zipping it up from inside but with practice it gets easier.
customer_reviews.author: John S. Linton

customer_reviews.title: Not warm enough
customer_reviews.text: Froze in 40 degree weather. Was nowhere near as warm as I was hoping.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Dreyer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Packed down small and was plenty warm for a 38 degree night.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Walter

customer_reviews.title: Still layer up.
customer_reviews.text: I love this sleeping bag, good value for the features. Excellent features in keeping draft air from coming in through the top. However, I still had to put on layers of clothing. Camping in Utah high Unitas in July (didn't drop below freezing) meant I needed to wear socks, long pants, puff-coat, and cap to stay warm.
customer_reviews.author: chcohi

customer_reviews.title: Best Value Around
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used this bag yet, but I know it will be great. I doubt you will find a bag of this design and quality anywhere near this price. I was thinking about saving a pound and going with a 40 degree bag, but I'm glad I have this 20 degree bag even though it weighs an extra pound (3 lbs. vs. 2). I got it to replace my North Face which is synthetic and takes up too much room in my pack.
customer_reviews.author: David W. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Very good, however the nature of the down fill is ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good, however the nature of the down fill is that when it is particularly cold, extra padding is needed underneath--I used a spare, thin summer sleeping bag between this and my cot or sleeping mat to help with the cold. Also the down has a tendancy to migrate, and fluffing is super necessary on a daily basis, especially on longer trips.
customer_reviews.author: klopez

customer_reviews.title: Best bag
customer_reviews.text: Quick delivery. Perfect bag for 6 night backpacking trip! Thanks Kelty!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I'm only 5' 6" but I wanted the added shoulder room.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Down bag!
customer_reviews.text: Almost a 1.3 lbs lighter than my previous synthetic 20 degree sleeping bag, and it compresses much smaller which frees up more room in my 65 L pack! Great looking and quality materials, I am excited to take this out backpacking!
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Butler

customer_reviews.title: I wanted a good bag for a cold camping trip and this did ...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a good bag for a cold camping trip and this did the job. It was around 20 degrees Fahrenheit and this kept me warm and comfortable. I didn't want to get out of it in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Clement

customer_reviews.title: So warm!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this sleeping bag several times now and boy is it toasty. I've only taken it down to about 35°f and can tell it will keep me warm at much lower temperatures. The down has great loft and fluffs back up nicely after being in my compression sack. I am 6'1" and I got the regular, concerned it might be too short but I fit nicely with no extra material. It also fits just like a mummy bag should. Other people have said it's too narrow and constricting but they just are not familiar with the fit of a mummy bag.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Warm, small, light bundle
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag fit me really well...I wasn't swimming in it like I often am (I purchased the "short" for individuals up to 5'6" and I am 5'3"). It was decently warm, I spent two nights in below freezing temps (upper 20s) and was fine. It rolls up to be a nice, small, light bundle which I appreciated from a packing/carrying standpoint. I like the "hood" because I could pack my pillow in there and not lose it during the night. Overall, this was a great investment and I am very happy with my purchase. It has served me well on my trip!!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley G.

customer_reviews.title: Good size, she was warm
customer_reviews.text: Daughter likes it. She's 5' or so, got her this to replace a 20F kids bag. Good size, she was warm, packs into a backpack nicely enough. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Leticia

customer_reviews.title: Very good sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Very good sleeping bag. It is a fair size, and could fit anyone about 6'4" or shorter. Taller than that and it might be difficult. It's a very warm sleeping bag with no need for extra blankets / warmth. Padding is nice. Stuffs down to a very small, maybe 6" by 6" bag.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Great on my first trip
customer_reviews.text: Awesome on my first week long trip. So far so good. Love it. the size the warmth and the price are awesome. Can't wait to go out again to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Christman

customer_reviews.title: Love this sleeping bag!
customer_reviews.text: Stayed warm and dry, packs down well and washes easily. Love this sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Tazi

customer_reviews.title: Outdoor enthusiasts, this is a good one
customer_reviews.text: Slept peacefully in the mountains of France with this bag. Lightweight, durable, and folded easily. I recommend to anyone doing some camping or hiking where nights could get a little cold.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it! If only there was a zip in the foot area..
customer_reviews.author: Darren

customer_reviews.title: Not warm
customer_reviews.text: There's no possible way this bag is rated for 20 degrees. Used it in summer time in High Sierra where temperature dropped maybe to low 40's and even with my base layer, down jacket, and wool hat I was still cold. But for the price I can't expect much else.
customer_reviews.author: Jason S. Kirmse

customer_reviews.title: He loved it. No caught zipper and stuffs down well
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 9 year old to go on school camping trip. He loved it. No caught zipper and stuffs down well. Could be fluffier, but for the price, this is a good bag and kept him warm. Have not tested in cold conditions.
customer_reviews.author: DuchessofNYC

customer_reviews.title: Super comfy and roomy for mummy bag.
customer_reviews.text: Super comfy and roomy for mummy bag. I'm a big guy, tall, broad shoulders, 240 lbs, etc. It fit me well and left me room to roll a round. I camped on a glacier one night and it was plenty warm with minimal clothing.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron B. Shelley

product_meta.title: Kelty Unisex Cosmic 20 Degree Sleeping Bag - Long
product_meta.description: Kelty Cosmic 20 Degree Sleeping Bag, Regular, Paradise Blue/Twilight OPEN BOX
feature_bullets: Cosmic Down 20 Degree DriDown means more moisture defense & quicker drying in the cold & wet, versatile for 3 seasons use, that's Kelty Built
Features: 550 fill DriDown, dual-slider locking zipper, Full draft collar, Thermal comfort hood & natural fit foot box, Zipper draft tube w/ antisnag
DriDown is treated to create a hydrophobic finish on each down plume, allows you to stay dry longer, loft better, & dry faster than untreated down
Sleeping Bag Comfort Rating: 20 F / -7 C, EN Lower Limit Rating: 19 F / -7 C
Dimensions: Fits to 6 ft, Weight 2 lbs 9oz, Stuff Size 8 x 14

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
